definitions.definition: used to introduce a statement that contrasts with something that has just been said

examples.text: He was feeling bad. He went to work, however, and tried to concentrate.
We thought the figures were correct. However, we have now discovered some errors.

definitions.definition: used with an adjective or adverb to mean ‘to whatever degree’

examples.text: He wanted to take no risks, however small.
She has the window open, however cold it is outside.
However carefully I explained, she still didn't understand.
However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.
It's easy to reach the city centre, however you choose to travel.
